results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Lux Film, Carlo Ponti and Virgilio Sabel
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)

results.title: A Gentle birth (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
This film shows the Le Boyer method of delivery - the childbirth experience of one woman where technological intervention is kept to a minimum, and drugs are replaced by a relaxed supportive environment, with the father present to reassure and comfort the mother. Narrated by Dr. Harry Tischler.

results.title: A Generation = Pokolenie
results.creator_credit: Zespol Filmowy KADR, Ignacy Taub and Andrzej Wajda
results.brief_description:
The first of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “Kanal” and “Ashes and Diamonds”) offers a strikingly unsentimental appraisal of heroism in this tale of a cocky Polish youth who decides to fight the Nazis after he falls for a pretty Resistance leader. Barely out of their teens, he and his brash friends approach their first mission - to help escapees during the Warsaw gheto uprising - like a game of cops and robbers. Inevitably the game turns deadly and the innocence of a generation is lost under the gruelling conditions of war. Adapted by Bohdan Czeszko from his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles.
Cast includes Roman Polanski

results.title: A Future without frontiers
results.creator_credit: Intergovernmental Committee for European Migration, Geo Tapparelli and Carlo di Carlo
results.brief_description: Produced to commemorate the twenty year of ICEM’s existence, this film aims to highlight one of the fundamental human rights - the freedom of movement - and to demonstrates at the same time that through well-planned migration an effective contribution can be made to people looking for better opportunities as well as to countries overseas to strengthen their economic position for further development. Looks at the various programmes carried out by ICEM in the last twenty years and projects some expected future problems of people and their movement in the world.

results.title: A Future on Rail
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Edgar H. Anstey
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film intended to show young people the changes taking place in rail-roads and the new sources of employment to be found in them.

results.title: A Future for the past
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and Peter Bradford
results.brief_description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.

results.title: A Frog's life
results.brief_description: After collecting frog spawn from a river and putting it into a tank, young children observe the hatching of the spawn and the development of the tadpoles into frogs. Close-up photography is used in recording the gradual change in the frog’s development.

results.title: A Friendly game
results.brief_description: A study and interpretation of the racist and capitalist philosophies. Two men, one white and one black, engage in a chess game, the stakes being $100 if the white man wins and the white man’s expensive chess set if he loses. At first the white man thinks the whole bet is silly since he appears to be winning. But, as the tables turn he becomes more and more upset until he loses and is unwilling to give up his chess set.

results.title: A Friend at the door
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James Beveridge and Leslie McFarlane
results.brief_description: This is a story of how rural social workers in British Columbia cover a large and rugged province, and of the ways in which they help people in many kinds of trouble to solve their problems. Taking four cases - a pensioner, a youngster in juvenile court, an unmarried mother and a family distressed by the threat of illness and poverty - the film describes how each case is investigated, and how people in need are put in touch with available aid, both government and private.
